text:
Welcome to howtocookthat.net I am Ann Reardon
and today we will be comparing different types
of fondant.

30g of each fondant was taken and rolled to
10cm long and then bent into a rainbow that
was 4cm tall.

What we are going to do is have a look at
these tomorrow and then in 2 weeks time to
see if they have sagged at all.

This is important 1 if you are making models
out of it but also when you put fondant on

a cake you don't want it to sag down and get
that bulge at the bottom of the cake.

Ok so this is 48 hours later we have bak els
pettinice, duff which has held its shape well,

satin ice which has gone down just a tiny
bit hardly at all, cake art has sunk quite

considerably we have homemade next, seems
to have held reasonably well, followed by

the marshmallow followed by orchard icing
which has held its shape reasonably well and
fondx which has also shrunk a little bit.

After leaving this fondant for two weeks to
dry out we are just going to check how firm

it is so if you'd made a model out of it and
left it to dry.

The bakels pettinice is very firm it is not
bending at all, it is still soft in the very

very centre but it has set hard about that
thickness there.

Next is the duff, it is still very soft, after
two weeks it is still soft the whole way through

you could actually remassage it and mold it
into something new so surprisingly it held

its shape really well but it also didn't set
hard, that's the duff.

Next we have satin ice, give it a press, that's
solid, satin ice has set hard on the outside
and has set through to about there.

So we have some soft in the middle after two
weeks but firm enough on the outside to keep
it in place.

We have cake art, still very soft as you would
expect, cake art as you already know is soft

the whole way through and can be completely
remolded because it hasn't set hard at all.

Home made icing that is solid home made has,
its set but its not as hard as the others

it is almost a crumbly texture which is why
it is breaking quite easily.

marshmallow, give it a push that is also solid
that one seems to have set the hardest I think

yep quite set the whole way through so that
one is very solid.

Orchard give that one a push, that's set nicely
so that's going to hold its shape easily,

still a little soft in the middle, set weel
on the outside so that is going to hold it
into shape.
Fondx give it a push on the top, set well.

actually looks very similar again, a little
bit soft right in the middle but is got a

good outer shell there the whole way around
so that is giving it its strength and holding
it in place.
